cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to stall and meander slowly east-northeast along the coast toward the upper Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O’Connor / Rockport, TX (middle Texas coast)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island; Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island; Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island, including Freeport and the Houston–Galveston area
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (49% peak) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; up to 54% chance of 50-kt winds and isolated hurricane-force gusts possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the Freeport coast, with large battering waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches of rain possible, producing life-threatening and prolonged flooding around the port and inland transportation routes.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes Friday into the weekend.
